statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} -8 \\ 2 \\ -11 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ 2 \\ -3 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ 0 \\ 2 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ 0 \\ -3 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ 0 \\ -5 \\ -2 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} -8 \\ 2 \\ -11 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] is a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ 2 \\ -3 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ 0 \\ 2 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ 0 \\ -3 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ 0 \\ -5 \\ -2 \end{array}\right].
